revised_title: The Localization of Activity in the Brain: A Ferrier Lecture
tldr: This article discusses the history and development of understanding the localization of activity in the brain, focusing on the work of Ferrier and the methods of electrical stimulation. It explores the phenomena of primary and secondary facilitation, and how these can reveal the plasticity and organization of the cerebral cortex. The article also touches on the electrical activity of the cortex and the potential waves recorded from the human brain, highlighting the importance of studying these processes for understanding brain function.
